Powder Mesh: DelaunayMesh

The mars.mesher.delanay_neigbour.DelaunayMesh class implements a spherical triangulation based on an adaptive grid in spherical coordinates (θ, φ). It is designed for disordered (powder) samples where all orientations are equally probable.

Key Features

  • Supports full-sphere or restricted φ ranges via phi_limits.

  • Optional interpolation from a coarse initial grid to a finer evaluation grid.

  • Returns rotation matrices that map the laboratory z-axis to each sampled direction.

  • Provides spherical triangle areas for proper integration weighting.

Usage

Typical initialization:

mesh = mesher.DelaunayMesh(
    initial_grid_frequency=30,
    interpolate=True,
    interpolation_grid_frequency=60,
    phi_limits=(0, 2 * np.pi)
    device=device,
    dtype=torch.float64
)

The mesh is used internally by mars.spin_model.MultiOrientedSample to average the spectrum over orientations.
